content:
Being able to see the pieces up close and even touch them can be a really intimate and revealing experience. It's great that Dr. Rodriguez was able to provide that kind of access and insight.

For learning more about the technical aspects of sculpture, here are some book recommendations and online resources that might be helpful:

Books:

1. "Sculpture: The Art of Modeling, Carving, Casting" by Élie Faure - This classic book covers the fundamentals of sculpture techniques, including modeling, carving, and casting.
2. "The Sculpture Reference Illustrated" by Arthur Williams - This comprehensive guide covers a wide range of sculpture techniques, from traditional methods to modern materials and processes.
3. "Sculpture: A Very Short Introduction" by Andrew Causey - This concise book provides an overview of the history and development of sculpture, as well as discussions of materials, techniques, and contemporary practices.
4. "The New Sculpture: Techniques and Materials" by Judy Siegel - This book focuses on contemporary sculpture techniques, including working with glass, metal, wood, and other materials.

Online Resources:

1. The Sculpture Center (NYC) - Their website has a wealth of resources, including artist interviews, exhibition archives, and educational materials on sculpture techniques and materials.
2. The Victoria and Albert Museum (London) - The V&A has an extensive online collection of sculpture, with detailed descriptions of materials, techniques, and artist biographies.
3. The Metropolitan Museum of Art (NYC) - The Met's Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History has a section dedicated to sculpture, with in-depth articles on various techniques, styles, and periods.
4. YouTube Channels:
	* Sculpture tutorials by artist and educator, Karen Rossi: Karen Rossi's channel has a wide range of tutorials on sculpture techniques, from beginner-friendly projects to more advanced processes.
	* The Sculpture Studio: This channel features video tutorials, artist interviews, and demonstrations of various sculpture techniques and materials.

Online Courses and Workshops:

1. Craftsy: Offers online courses and workshops on sculpture techniques, such as figurative sculpture, wood carving, and metalworking.
2. Skillshare: Provides online classes and workshops on sculpture, including topics like clay modeling, 3D printing, and mixed media sculpture.
3. The Sculpture Academy: Offers online courses and tutorials on sculpture techniques, including stone carving, wood sculpture, and bronze casting.

These resources should give you a good starting point for exploring the technical aspects of sculpture. Enjoy your continued learning journey!
